title: Can We Do Something About Low Priority Queue Prompt?
body:
so im playing a game and i afk it because i am angry at teammates and no longer want to play the match instead of being abusive towards them and i get put in a low priority queue. cool. i think it's great to play a game where the publisher actually gives two flying you know whats about people screwing their teams like that, unlike some other publishers *cough* Blizzard *cough* with certain IPs *cough cough* Overwatch *cough* they are trying to make a successful Esport.

But uh... dude. I have this prompt in my face for the entire low priority queue and cant browse anything else in the game launcher while I wait.

replies.body:
The punishment for breaking the rules **is supposed to annoy you** because otherwise there'd be no point in handing it out.

I suggest that next time you play instead of afk-ing

>and i afk it because i am angry at teammates and no longer want to play the match instead of being abusive towards them 

Or you could... you know... do your best, mute them and keep playing... that works too.

You have to remember that players that are on a pre 30 account are either new players or smurfs with a huge ego. If neither of them are something you can handle then maybe this isn't the game for you...

> [{quoted}](name=Voldymort,realm=EUNE,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=vohrhKoM,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2018-09-28T04:50:52.466+0000)
>
> The punishment for breaking the rules **is supposed to annoy you**

always has to be that one guy that is trying way too hard to salt the wound and couldn't see the forest for the trees

He's actually correct here. Not being able to browse anywhere else, not being able to 'wait out' the penalty, and having to be there to accept the queue is all intended. It's supposed to be punishing.

> He's actually correct here. Not being able to browse anywhere else, not being able to 'wait out' the penalty, and having to be there to accept the queue is all intended. It's supposed to be punishing.

Though doesn't that make them just Alt-Tab or browse on their phone.... I don't see how that is preferable to them browsing around on your own client?

Well, they can't legally stop you from doing other stuff on the computer or phone. Computerwise that would force LoL files ro interact with other files of your computer to prevent use until criteria was met. Aka ransomware 

Phone wise, well, not sure how they could prevent that with remote hacking somehow.

It is only preferable in regards that they lose privileges in client while making sure the person in LPQ has a stable connection to last x amount of time.

<3 you, Tantram

{{sticker:sg-jinx}}

> [{quoted}](name=Riot Tantram,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=vohrhKoM,comment-id=000000000001,timestamp=2018-09-28T06:28:40.935+0000)
>
> He's actually correct here. Not being able to browse anywhere else, not being able to 'wait out' the penalty, and having to be there to accept the queue is all intended. It's supposed to be punishing.

Seinfeld theme song

> [{quoted}](name=Riot Tantram,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=vohrhKoM,comment-id=000000000001,timestamp=2018-09-28T06:28:40.935+0000)
>
> He's actually correct here.

More like X-files theme...

> [{quoted}](name=Riot Tantram,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=vohrhKoM,comment-id=000000000001,timestamp=2018-09-28T06:28:40.935+0000)
>
> He's actually correct here. Not being able to browse anywhere else, not being able to 'wait out' the penalty, and having to be there to accept the queue is all intended. It's supposed to be punishing.

Must be the wisdom you've shared with Overwatch developers because their punishments aren't very effective when they are intended to be punishments. Like bruh, I can cancel the queue if I want to browse the launcher or watch a movie or something while I wait lol... That's not really a punishment man and if you ask me it even seems like it's very lazy design.

But hey, the red has spoken and on top of that the guy is a software engineer so I really have to trust them when they say it's intended. Do me a favor though and go get the OW dev team sold on a leaverbuster feature too - they could really use it. All criticisms of your... minor nuisance that is intended to be a "punishment" aside, I really do admire your implementation of the leaverbuster system.

>That's not really a punishment man and if you ask me it even seems like it's very lazy design

I find it interesting that you simultaneously complain about Leaverbuster and brush it off as nothing in the same thread. Your OP makes it clear that it frustrates you, yet here you say it is not a punishment. If it was a "minor nuisance" as you say, you would not have made a post dedicated to complaining about it.

Ohhhh the old "if you didn't care, you wouldn't post about it"

I don't care at all that I was placed in a lower priority queue for leaving games and I actually applaud a game developer for having enough respect for it's competitive community to create a system that will weed out players that make the game less fun to play.

It just seemed off to me that I couldn't browse through the launcher. Like bruh who calls that a punishment? oh no i cant spend my money in your store while i'm queued for games. what ever will i do lmao

> Ohhhh the old "if you didn't care, you wouldn't post about it"

That is actually the way people engage with their environments. If you truly did not care about a situation, you would not have posted on it. For example, if I did not care about my lawn, not even in the slightest, I would not even make the half-assed attempt to keep the weeds from taking over. The point is I do care to *some* degree. Say you don't care about the system all you want, your posts here are evidence to the contrary.

> I don't care at all that I was placed in a lower priority queue for leaving games and I actually applaud a game developer for having enough respect for it's competitive community to create a system that will weed out players that make the game less fun to play.
> 
> It just seemed off to me that I couldn't browse through the launcher. Like bruh who calls that a punishment? oh no i cant spend my money in your store while i'm queued for games. what ever will i do lmao

I do want to thank you for proving my point. The part where you say "It just seemed off to me that I couldn't browse through the launcher" is the clearest evidence of the degree to which you care about the system (or it's supposed flaws). Oh sure, you may be accepting that the system in its entirety exists ("...I actually applaud a game developer for having enough respect for it's competitive community to create a system..."), but you do care about a perceived problem with some details of its implementation.

tl;dr: You actually do care.

Yes, I'm pretty sure people are much more incline to spend money while being annoyed and punished with LPQ and not allowed to play the game....  These are the same people who spends more money on a new account after being stripped of everything they bought previously with a perma-ban right?

You don't feel that there is EVER an acceptable reason to leave in the middle of a video game?

How about someone shooting a gun at you? (Madden)
What if your entire team has disconnected for over 10 minutes and the enemy team is ignoring objectives while spam dancing you?
What if there is a medical emergency?
What if your work calls you in on your day off?
What if the fire alarm is going off?
What if someone hits a power line and the local region loses power?

Thanks for listening! {{sticker:slayer-pantheon-thumbs}}

> [{quoted}](name=mlm olo mlm,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=vohrhKoM,comment-id=0000000000010004,timestamp=2018-09-28T17:06:54.120+0000)
>
> You don't feel that there is EVER an acceptable reason to leave in the middle of a video game?
> 
> How about someone shooting a gun at you? (Madden)
> What if your entire team has disconnected for over 10 minutes and the enemy team is ignoring objectives while spam dancing you?
> What if there is a medical emergency?
> What if your work calls you in on your day off?
> What if the fire alarm is going off?
> What if someone hits a power line and the local region loses power?
> 
> Thanks for listening! {{sticker:slayer-pantheon-thumbs}}

There's a difference between having to leave due to an emergency/unexpected situation and leaving just cause you feel like it or because things aren't going your way. The people who consistently do the latter are the ones who are consistently hit with Leaverbuster. Either way though there is only so much leniency you can be given with the system before enough is enough, so it is your responsibility to make sure that you have as little reason to leave and/or afk as possible. From the [Leaverbuster FAQ](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752714-LeaverBuster-FAQ#h3q3): 

>**IT'S NOT MY FAULT. MY INTERNET/YOUR SERVERS DISCONNECTED ME. I HAD A REAL-LIFE EMERGENCY. I HAD TO GET OFF THE COMPUTER. THE GAME CRASHED. UNBAN ME!**
We understand that players may be forced to leave from time to time so the system has been designed to keep these situations in mind. After leaving a few games, you will be placed into a low priority queue; as long as you can complete 5 matchmade games without leaving, you will be returned to the normal queue. However, if you continue to leave games, you will remain in the low priority queue.

Stop playing for at least a day and beg for support assistance.

OR

Suck up the 25 minute unfair punishment.

Shitty system is shit.

> [{quoted}](name=mlm olo mlm,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=vohrhKoM,comment-id=000000000001000400000000,timestamp=2018-09-28T23:10:25.196+0000)
>
> Stop playing for at least a day and beg for support assistance.
> 
> OR
> 
> Suck up the 25 minute unfair punishment.
> 
> Shitty system is shit.

I fail to see how it's unfair to have to wait 20 minutes in LPQ for frequent leaves/afks. If they didn't want to have to wait that long then they shouldn't have left/afked in games so much that it got to that point. That's not the systems fault, that's the fault of the player. From the [Leaverbuster FAQ](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752714-LeaverBuster-FAQ#h2q2): 

>**HOW LONG WILL I REMAIN IN THE LOW PRIORITY QUEUE?**
You will be placed in the low priority queue for 5 games. If you continuously leave, the low priority queue timers increase from 5 minutes per game to 10 minutes per game and then capping out at 20 minutes per game.

I'm sorry, your links aren't working. Probably on my end.

If what Voldymort linked is true, then I don't think it's fair that you used the word "frequent". You make it sound like the system is lenient when it is actually not.

> [{quoted}](name=mlm olo mlm,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=vohrhKoM,comment-id=00000000000100040000000000010001,timestamp=2018-09-29T02:17:28.171+0000)
>
> I'm sorry, your links aren't working. Probably on my end.

Weird. Try this: https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752714-LeaverBuster-FAQ#h2q2
 
> If what Voldymort linked is true, then I don't think it's fair that you used the word "frequent". You make it sound like the system is lenient when it is actually not.

It's lenient to the point that very infrequent leaves/afks here and there usually won't result in a Leaverbuster punishment (the built-in leniency). Having a frequent amount of leaves/afks though uses up that leniency and results in an LB punishment when it becomes a habit.

Think of it like sick leave. Say you have 3 days of sick leave a month (example) to use when needed. If you use them up for vacation time then when you actually do get sick you no longer have those sick days available to use and now have to go into work as punishment for abusing them.

The quote literally says "just 1-2 games".

You gave more leniency in your made up analogy than Riot games gives its players.

> [{quoted}](name=mlm olo mlm,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=vohrhKoM,comment-id=0000000000010004000000000001000100000000,timestamp=2018-09-29T16:40:29.620+0000)
>
> The quote literally says "just 1-2 games".
> 
> You gave more leniency in your made up analogy than Riot games gives its players.

Yes it says 1-2 games but it's as an example. In other words if you've used up the leniency then you can get punished for leaving 1-2 additional games if that makes sense. If that's not a good enough explanation then perhaps someone else can explain it better than I can.

I think I understand what you are saying. I think you are wrong though. The key word in the quote is "just". 

>However, it is possible to be **punished for leaving just 1-2 games**.

and the other key word that you keep missing is "possible"

possible =/= probable=/= it will happen 100% of the time

example: "it's possible for my cat to do a 360 frontflip when jumping from the tree. is it probable that he'll do that instead of just landing? no. will he do it every time? do i even need to answer that?"

Possible = may happen. 

People may get punished for leaving just 1 game. Not very lenient. 2 games? Not very lenient. 3 games? I acknowledge there is a problem but not sold on punishment being the solution.

> [{quoted}](name=mlm olo mlm,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=vohrhKoM,comment-id=000000000001000400000000000100010000000000000000,timestamp=2018-09-29T20:04:59.465+0000)
>
> I think I understand what you are saying. I think you are wrong though. The key word in the quote is "just".

I understand that it says "just 1-2 games" but from my understanding of how LB works that's only after one uses up all their leniency since if we go back to the part from the LB FAQ I posted earlier it says there is some leniency built into the system for unexpected situations where one may be forced to leave or afk:

>**IT'S NOT MY FAULT. MY INTERNET/YOUR SERVERS DISCONNECTED ME. I HAD A REAL-LIFE EMERGENCY. I HAD TO GET OFF THE COMPUTER. THE GAME CRASHED. UNBAN ME!**
We understand that players may be forced to leave from time to time so the system has been designed to keep these situations in mind. After leaving a few games, you will be placed into a low priority queue; as long as you can complete 5 matchmade games without leaving, you will be returned to the normal queue. However, if you continue to leave games, you will remain in the low priority queue.

> [{quoted}](name=mlm olo mlm,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=vohrhKoM,comment-id=00000000000100040000000000010001000000000000000000000000,timestamp=2018-09-29T21:08:46.040+0000)
>
> You don't have any evidence of the length of "leniency period"?
> 
> I was under the impression that everyone got 1 warning. Then every offense after triggered punishment.

No I don't, and I doubt Riot would release it either since the dishonorable people out there would use that information to try to game the system. Also, and this part is just speculation from me, but I wouldn't be surprised if the length of the grace period varies from person to person.

You don't have any evidence of the length of "leniency period"?

I was under the impression that everyone got 1 warning. Then every offense after triggered punishment.
How many games does it take to trigger a leaverbuster punishment?

_I JUST DISCONNECTED FROM TWO GAMES! AM I GOING TO GET BANNED?
No, your account will not be banned. However, it is possible to be punished for leaving just 1-2 games. Players who leave games will be placed in a low priority queue and will be required to play 5 matchmade games without leaving before exiting low priority queue._

https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752714

"getting punished for afking is unfair"

{{champion:33}} ok
Good job using quotes to quote something no one said.
it's called [paraphrasing](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Paraphrase)

> [{quoted}](name=Riot Tantram,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=vohrhKoM,comment-id=000000000001,timestamp=2018-09-28T06:28:40.935+0000)
>
> He's actually correct here. Not being able to browse anywhere else, not being able to 'wait out' the penalty, and having to be there to accept the queue is all intended. It's supposed to be punishing.

see, that makes sense and all, but what if people want to go spend money in your store but they can't because their internet is bad and they get put in low priority queue a lot
Then maybe they should look up if they can use that money to get a better connection. There are ways to do such without necessarily upgrading the internet

> [{quoted}](name=Riot Tantram,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=vohrhKoM,comment-id=000000000001,timestamp=2018-09-28T06:28:40.935+0000)
>
> He's actually correct here. Not being able to browse anywhere else, not being able to 'wait out' the penalty, and having to be there to accept the queue is all intended. It's supposed to be punishing.

Hello not  related to this post can I know why I got banned for 14 days while my bullies didnâ€™t get anything?
well you're annoyed that the trees are there so i'm just clarifying it for you

> [{quoted}](name=Voldymort,realm=EUNE,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=vohrhKoM,comment-id=000000000000,timestamp=2018-09-28T05:30:15.945+0000)
>
> well you're annoyed that the trees are there so i'm just clarifying it for you

No, you are trolling. Literally the only reason you published your post was to get a reaction out of me and attempt to irritate me. While you have succeeded in the latter, I have to say it is no spectacular feat.

I would like to be able to browse the shop. I would like to be able to browse my inventory. Perhaps I would like to use the text chat to speak to my friends on LoL. Maybe I would even like to purchase RP. I am level 18 and own all but 4 Riven Skins after all, but I don't NEED to do any of these things... So it's really Riot's loss and not mine.

Either way you are a little too late to be rubbing it in, but it's just a suggestion. Really doesn't bother me none to play another game while I wait for queue.

>No, you are trolling. Literally the only reason you published your post was to get a reaction out of me and attempt to irritate me. 

i'm sorry the truth hurts

{{sticker:zombie-nunu-bummed}} 

>I would like to be able to browse the shop. I would like to be able to browse my inventory. Perhaps I would like to use the text chat to speak to my friends on LoL. Maybe I would even like to purchase RP.

and the teammates you abandoned due to your hissie fit would have liked to play the game in a 5v5 format

{{champion:43}} 's a bitch

> {{champion:43}} 's a bitch

**BOI-HOWDY**
Just play a different game while waiting lol, not hard at all.

Like it or not Voldymort is exactly right. If you want to be able to avoid being in Low Priority Queue then stop leaving games when things don't go your way. If you must rage then do so at the screen instead of in chat so you don't compromise your teams chances of success.

Prandine and Tantram are praising me
